result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Solicitation of Prostitutes, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: any treatment as deemed appropriate by agent
any treatment as deemed appropriate by agent

DOC and/or Law enforcement may search garage premises at any time.

No unrelated females to be present in garage.
Not to pay any females for photos or sexual activity.
No photographing nude or partially nude females.
All photos, DVD's, movies currently in custody of police department to be forfeited to police department.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Patterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert L. Patterson in court with attorney Tod O Daniel.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counts 1 and 3, dismissed and read in, Count 2, guilty plea entered, Court orders sentence withheld, 3 yr probation, DOC or Law Enforcement may search garage premises at any time, no unrelated females to be present in garage, not to pay any females for photos or sexula activity, no photographing nude or partially nude females, all photos, DVD's currently in custody of police department to be forfeited to police department, any treatment deemed appropriate by agent, $113.00 costs paid in full from bond posted

Calendar call on June 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert L. Patterson in court with attorney Tod O Daniel.  Jodi D Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing, information filed by the State, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court.  Bond continued.

Defendant Robert L. Patterson in court with attorney Tod O. Daniel.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denies motion to dismiss.  Deft requests preliminary hearing time limits are waived.  Preliminary Hearing set for 4-22-2014  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Motion hearing on April 2, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant Robert L. Patterson in court with attorney Tod O Daniel.  Jodi L Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remand to Branch 6 for motion hearing
Defendant Robert L. Patterson in court.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed, set prelim, time limits waived.
